title: Lecture 16: Recursion on Non-Numerics
content:
Topics: Recursion: Fibonacci, Fibonacci with a dict, recursion on non-numerics, recursion on lists, Towers of Hanoi (extra)
Viewing videos requires an internet connection View video page Download video Download transcript Lecture Notes Lecture 16: Recursion on Non-Numerics
Lecture 16 Code
Readings Ch 6.2–6.4 Finger Exercise Lecture 16 Implement the function that meets the specifications below:
def flatten(L): """ L: a list Returns a copy of L, which is a flattened version of L """ # Your code here # Examples: L = [[1,4,[6],2],[[[3]],2],4,5] print(flatten(L)) # prints the list [1,4,6,2,3,2,4,5] 6.100L Finger Exercises Lecture 16 Solutions
